intro: Erodium subtrilobum var. neuradifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf common bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in coastal regions. The species is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
